oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Union Capt. Edward Dale
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing his wife, Capt. Dale of the Wisconsin ? talks of making "quite an expedition up into East Tenn." of Hood's returning North after a fight at Dalton, GA, and Gen. Sherman's movements outside Atlanta, GA and his vast "paraphernalia of war"" He says: "There is also here a large number of refugee families; their condition is really pitiable. Their intention was to go North, but for want of transportation, they have accumulated here."
